t: Ezekiel 28
The Fall of Tyre’s Ruler
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, ‘This is what the Lord God*s says: Your heart is proud, and you have said, “I am a god; I sit in the seat of gods in the heart of the sea.” Yet you are a man and not a god, though you have regarded your heart as that of a god.
Yes, you are wiser than Daniel; no secret is hidden from you!
By your wisdom and understanding you have acquired wealth for yourself. You have acquired gold and silver for your treasuries.
By your great skill in trading you have increased your wealth, but your heart has become proud because of your wealth.
“‘Therefore,*p this is what the Lord God*s says: Because*pn you regard your heart as that of a god,
I*ln am about to bring strangers against you, ruthless*ln men from the nations. They*ln will draw their swords against*ln your magnificent wisdom and*ln will pierce your splendor.
They*ln will bring you down to the Pit, and*ln you will die a violent death in*ln the heart of the sea.
Will*ln you still say, “I am a god,” in*ln the presence of those who slay you? Yet*ln you will be only a man, not a god, in*ln the hands of those who kill you.
You*ln will die the death of the uncircumcised at*ln the hands of strangers. For*ln I have spoken. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God*s .’”
A Lament for Tyre’s King
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, lament for the king of Tyre and say to him, ‘This is what the Lord God*s says: You*pn were the seal of perfection, full*ln of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

You*ln were in Eden, the garden of God. Every*ln kind of precious stone covered you: carnelian,*ln topaz, and diamond, beryl,*ln onyx, and jasper, lapis*ln lazuli, turquoise and emerald. Your*ln mountings and settings were crafted in gold; they*ln were prepared on the day you were created.
You*ln were an anointed guardian cherub, for*ln I had appointed you. You*ln were on the holy mountain of God; you*ln walked among the fiery stones.
From*ln the day you were created you*ln were blameless in your ways until*ln wickedness was found in you.

Through*ln the abundance of your trade, you*ln were filled with violence, and you sinned. So*ln I expelled you in disgrace from*ln the mountain of God, and*ln banished you, guardian cherub, from*ln among the fiery stones.
Your*ln heart became proud because of your beauty; For*ln the sake of your splendor you*ln corrupted your wisdom. So*ln I threw you down to the ground; I*ln made you a spectacle before kings.

You*ln profaned your sanctuaries by*ln the magnitude of your iniquities in*ln your dishonest trade. So*ln I made fire come from within you, and*ln it consumed you. I*ln reduced you to ashes on the ground in*ln the sight of everyone watching you.
All*ln those who know you among the peoples are*ln appalled at you. You*ln have become an object of horror and*ln will never exist again.’”
A Prophecy against Sidon
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, face Sidon and prophesy against it.

You are to say, ‘This is what the Lord God*s says: Look!*pn I am against you, Sidon, and*ln I will display my glory within you. They*ln will know that I am the Lord*s when*ln I execute judgments against her and*ln demonstrate my holiness through her.
I*ln will send a plague against her and*ln bloodshed in her streets; the*ln slain will fall within her, while*ln the sword is against her on every side. Then*ln they will know that I am the Lord.*s
“‘The*p house of Israel will no longer be hurt by prickly briers or painful thorns from all their neighbors who treat them with contempt. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.*s

“‘This*p is what the Lord God*s says: When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples where they are scattered, I will demonstrate my holiness through them in the sight of the nations, and they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.

They will live there securely, build houses, and plant vineyards. They will live securely when I execute judgments against all their neighbors who treat them with contempt. Then they will know that I am the Lord*s their God.’”
